title: College Seminar
desc: Small, writing and discussion-oriented course exploring a specific topic or theme, and introducing skills necessary to thriving at Northwestern. Not eligible to be applied towards a WCAS major or minor except where specifically indicated.

title: First-Year Writing Seminar
desc: Small, writing and discussion-oriented course exploring a specific topic or theme, and focused on the fundamentals of effective, college-level written communication. Not eligible to be applied towards a WCAS major or minor except where specifically indicated.

title: Elementary Czech
desc: Czech language and culture. Basic reading, writing, listening, and speaking.  No prerequisite.

title: Introduction to Russian Literature
desc: Comprehensive overview of the central prose works and literary movements in 19th-century Russia. 1. Thematic and formal study of major works by Pushkin, Gogol, Lermontov, Turgenev. 2. Tolstoy, Dostoevsky. 3. Turgenev, the late Tolstoy, Chekhov, Bunin. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Introduction to Russian Literature
desc: Comprehensive overview of the central prose works and literary movements in 19th-century Russia. 1. Thematic and formal study of major works by Pushkin, Gogol, Lermontov, Turgenev. 2. Tolstoy, Dostoevsky. 3. Turgenev, the late Tolstoy, Chekhov, Bunin. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Introduction to Russian Literature
desc: Comprehensive overview of the central prose works and literary movements in 19th-century Russia. 1. Thematic and formal study of major works by Pushkin, Gogol, Lermontov, Turgenev. 2. Tolstoy, Dostoevsky. 3. Turgenev, the late Tolstoy, Chekhov, Bunin. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: 20th-Century Russian Literature
desc: Major works in cultural-historical context, from the revolutions of 1917 through the present. Variable content depending on instructor. Focus on one of the following: Russian modernism in literature, music, film, and visual art; non-conformism in Soviet literature and visual arts (1940s to 1986); and contemporary Russian culture. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: 20th-Century Russian Literature
desc: Major works in cultural-historical context, from the revolutions of 1917 through the present. Variable content depending on instructor. Russian literature, film, and visual art in the transition from communism to post-communism. Writers examined may include Pasternak, Bulgakov, Solzhenitsyn, and Sinyavsky/Tertz. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Introduction to Polish Literature
desc: Survey of key literary works in Poland from the 19th century to the present. Focus on literary movements such as romanticism, realism, the Young Poland Movement, the avant-garde, Holocaust literature, and dissident and queer literature. Global Perspectives on Power, Justice, and Equity Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Language, Politics, & Identity
desc: Role of language in constructing, preserving, and manipulating political and national identities. Topics include language discrimination, linguistic nationalism, language and religion, alphabet issues, dialect issues. Regional content varies. LING 222-0 and SLAVIC 222-0 are taught together; may not receive credit for both courses. Ethics Values Distro Area Historical Studies Distro Area Interdisciplinary Distro - See Rules

title: Balkan Civilizations
desc: Culture, history, politics, language, and literature of the Balkans historically and/or in modern periods. Content varies with instructor; may be repeated for credit. Restricted to students participating in NU-sponsored study abroad programs. Global Perspectives on Power, Justice, and Equity Historical Studies Distro Area Historical Studies Foundational Discipline

title: Slavic Civilizations
desc: Culture, history, language, and literature of the Slavs historically and/or in modern periods. Content varies with instructor; may be repeated for credit. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Economics and the Humanities: Understanding Choice
desc: A conversation among disciplines, especially economics and literary studies. Explores social, ethical, and political big questions. Ethics Values Distro Area Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Heart of Europe: Poland in the Twentieth Century
desc: Study of key developments in Polish history, literature, and thought by way of texts drawn from literature, history, politics, journalism, memoirs, essays, and film. Poland as a microcosm for recent European history and culture. Historical Studies Distro Area Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Czech Culture: Film, Visual Arts & Music
desc: Czech culture represented in film and visual arts. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Visual Art in the Context of Russian Culture
desc: Introduction to the history of Russian art: survey of major trends in Russian visual art in the dual contexts of Russian culture and European visual art. Focus on interconnections among visual arts, literature, and political history. Russian art from the medieval period to the beginning of the 20th century. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Visual Art in the Context of Russian Culture
desc: Introduction to the history of Russian art: survey of major trends in Russian visual art in the dual contexts of Russian culture and European visual art. Focus on interconnections among visual arts, literature, and political history. Russian art of the 20th century.

title: Tolstoy
desc: SLAVIC 310-0 Tolstoy (1 Unit) Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Dostoevsky
desc: SLAVIC 311-0 Dostoevsky (1 Unit) Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Chekhov
desc: SLAVIC 314-0 Chekhov (1 Unit) Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Polish Cinema
desc: Development of Polish film from silent era to contemporary times with focus on major historical and political events in Poland in the twentieth and twenty-first centuries. Special focus on what it means to study “national cinema.”. Global Perspectives on Power, Justice, and Equity Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Making a Dictionary: The Northwestern Project
desc: Creation of an online dictionary of Northwestern language. Learning about the connection between language, society, and identity; sociolinguistic fieldwork; lexicography; politics of dictionaries. LING 363-0 and SLAVIC 322-0 are taught together; may not receive credit for both courses. Social Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

title: Prague: City of Cultures, City of Conflict
desc: Examination of the cultural, political, and social transformation of Prague from the 19th century to the present. Cosmopolitan Prague, communist Prague, and capitalist Prague. SLAVIC 328-0 and GERMAN 328-0 are taught together; may not receive credit for both courses. Global Perspectives on Power, Justice, and Equity Historical Studies Distro Area Interdisciplinary Distro - See Rules Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Structure of Modern Russian
desc: SLAVIC 341-0 Structure of Modern Russian (1 Unit) Formal Studies Distro Area

title: Survey of 19th Century Russian Poetry
desc: SLAVIC 360-0 Survey of 19th Century Russian Poetry (1 Unit) Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Survey of 20th Century Russian Poetry
desc: SLAVIC 361-0 Survey of 20th Century Russian Poetry (1 Unit) Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Russian Film
desc: Development of Russian film and film theory from the silent era to the 1980s. Golden Age of Russian cinema (Eisenstein, Pudovkin, Vertov, Protazanov, Vasiliev brothers, Dovzhenko, socialist realism). Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Andrei Tarkovsky's Aesthetics and World Cinema
desc: Major films of Tarkovsky and of Russian and non-Russian directors whose work is related to his (Eisenstein, Wenders, Bergman, Kurosawa). Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Russian Drama
desc: SLAVIC 369-0 Russian Drama (1 Unit) Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: History and Culture in Central and Eastern Europe
desc: SLAVIC 390-0 History and Culture in Central and Eastern Europe (1 Unit) Advanced Expression Historical Studies Distro Area Historical Studies Foundational Discipline Interdisciplinary Distro - See Rules Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: East European Literature and Visual Arts
desc: Course focuses on the intersection of literature, visual arts, film, and politics in Central and Eastern Europe. Content varies; may be repeated for credit. Advanced Expression Literature Fine Arts Distro Area Literature and Arts Foundational Discipline

title: Topics in Literature and Arts
desc: Content varies. May be repeated for credit. Literature Fine Arts Distro Area

title: Independent Study
desc: For majors selected as candidates for departmental honors; for other advanced students with consent of instructor.

title: Independent Study
desc: For majors selected as candidates for departmental honors; for other advanced students with consent of instructor.
